column4: i haven't had problems with ubuntu since i got it a few weeks ago, and all of a sudden, it will stop booting right after "Running local boot scripts".. it will start fine if i boot to text mode and startx... i have no idea why
I've had problems with 'kdm'. Could it be that?
no it appears to be the gdm
Have you had a look at 'dmesg' and 'less /var/log/messages' ?
milosevic you can put commands (one per line) in the file /etc/rc.local
last thing dmesg says is "apm: BIOS not found."
old computer?
relatively new laptop
a year old maybe two
hmmm. Have you had a look for other peoples guides for that model. From http://www.linux-laptop.net/ for example?
or even the ubuntu forums/wiki
Did you update/upgrade any packages?
maybe.. i was playing around with the wrt54g firmware source and i had to get a few thigns to build it, but i think i've restarted fine since then
is there a way to find out what might be stopping gdm from loading?
'cat /var/log/gdm.log'
Try kdm for a short term fix then.
after apt-get install kdm, what can i do to set it as the default instead of gnome?
as you install it one of the questions should be regarding just that...
btw switching to kdm solved the problem, thank you
Annoying but I thought it might. You're welcome.
.... why does kdm look exactly like gdm?
consistencey of prettiness.
You have differences if you want to start autologin and stuff cause it's from the kde end of the world but apart from that it's virtually the same.
